reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of my new favorite graphic novels
reviews.reviewText: This book simply put … is beautiful. Lang’s story and art are one of a kind. As an artist myself I’ll be studying his format with panel layouts and color. The light he uses with the black and white art was a nice touch. The story is wonderful and would definitely recommend this graphic novel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A wonderful story
reviews.reviewText: 4 stars - It was really goodThis was a wonderful story full of myth and folklore. I really enjoyed Issunboshi’s journey and all the creatures he fought along the way. My only real complaint, which isn’t a real one really, was that I wish this had been in color just like the cover, but the black and white was beautifully done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great story, great art, and AMAZING use of comic book layouts!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A good entertaining story, a bit short but nice content, loved the art.Looking forward for a follow-up series. X

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Meh at best, but the art is pretty
reviews.reviewText: First, let me start with what is good about this graphic novel: it is gorgeous. Even in black and white, the art is absolutely breathtaking. The character design is top notch and I’ve never seen movement like this in a graphic novel. It feels like an animated movie.Unfortunately the characters felt very one dimensional and I was told to be interested in them but I never was. The story was boring. I knew exactly what was going to happen and there was never any real agency. I know this was based on a myth and it felt like a myth being told around a campfire, good triumphs over evil and that’s it. It’s been done a million times and there was nothing to make this telling interesting or stand out. Also, I wish it was in color.This is a book I’ll keep, but I’ll never read it again and I won’t recommend it to anyone unless someone just wants some really gorgeous art to look at.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A fun graphic novel set in feudal Japan
reviews.reviewText: Overall this was a well done graphic novel that moved quickly, was action-packed, and speaks to how we all have the opportunity to be heroes, no matter what that looks like. This felt like a feudal Japan twist on Ant-Man and Thumbelina and I absolutely loved it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very loosely based on the original story
reviews.reviewText: Growing up Little One-Inch was one of my favorite stories (I read it in Florence Sakade’s collection and also in the Island Heritage book), so I immediately requested this when I saw it on NetGalley.And maybe my expectations were calibrated properly. If I didn’t know the story, maybe I would’ve enjoyed this more. Lang made the story more epic than it was—I get that’s what happens with graphic novels, but maybe I’m just too attached to the original. When you love something, it can be hard to read something else loosely based on it.The art was gorgeous, and I liked the new characters. I just would have much preferred something more based on the original story.Thank you to NetGalley and Oni Press!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great fun with incredible art
reviews.reviewText: A fantastically cinematic graphic novel adaptation of a Japanese folktale that I cannot stop myself from describing as "Action Thumbelina, with demons". Not only is the art exciting, kinetic, and beautiful, but the story is a great deal of fun and has a lovely, kids'-movie-ready message.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is an amazing piece of work that needs to be made into a film. Incredible art and great story
Muy buena novela gráfica con los excelentes dibujos de un artista de élite como es Ryan Lang.
